concept_data.title: European Agreement concerning the International Carriage of Dangerous Goods on the Rhine

summary: The "European Agreement concerning the International Carriage of Dangerous Goods on the Rhine," commonly referred to as the "ADN agreement," is a pivotal regulatory framework governing the transport of hazardous materials via inland waterways in the EU. This agreement establishes safety standards and operational protocols to mitigate risks associated with the carriage of dangerous goods, ensuring environmental protection and public safety. As a key instrument in maritime and inland waterway transport, the ADN agreement facilitates cross-border cooperation among member states, aligning national regulations with EU directives. Its implementation is crucial for harmonizing transport practices and enhancing regulatory compliance across the region.
